reviews.title: Ambiente di lavoro giovane e positivo
reviews.text: Nell’ambiente di lavoro, colleghi giovani, poca possibilità di carriera in Italia

reviews.title: Bien dans l’ensemble
reviews.text:
Bonne ambiance
Possibilité d’evolution
Salaires correct

reviews.title: Productive and fun workplace with great benefits
reviews.text: I loved working for this company, the benefits were great, the job had a clear vision for progression, incredibly multicultural and inclusive with a competitive salary.

reviews.title: Company is closing
reviews.text: First years were amazing. Went to Europe. Company failed their employees. Took a dive when covid hit. Alot of employees were fired with no notice at all.

reviews.title: Senior CS
reviews.text: The work load was overwhelming, and you were micromanaged within every minute of you day, they have alot of favoritism, and the company sold their CS department to anoter company so they wont have to pay their EEs severance
reviews.pros: no much tbh I had the worst manager

reviews.title: Great company with high translation standards.
reviews.text:
I have been a translator all my life long but translating within the hospitality sphere turned out to be more challenging than I thought it would be. 

Overall, it was a good learning experience but at the end I discovered that hospitality arena was not my cup of tea.

reviews.title: Just don't.
reviews.text: Booking forced me to learn on the fly and sink or swim. I'm very glad for the opportunities they created in the lay offs that better places to work exist.

reviews.title: Good co-workers
reviews.text: Work hard and fast environment. Good co-workers. Friendly environment.

reviews.title: Great work culture and environment . Tough calls.
reviews.text: It was a call centre so having a work life balance is nearly impossible with any company. The training was okay but definitely better than more. They at least invested in a training version of their CSM so you can practice. They have a phone in help desk for assistance during a call and they have a tech support department if your having issues with your computer. HR is available and accessible. Benefits are good and requesting time off is not difficult but obviously still needs to go through an approval process. The queue itself was very fast paced and the calls can be stressful.

reviews.title: カスタマーサポート
reviews.text: いろんな国籍の人がいる。英語が必須とされているが、そこまで達者である必要ではなく、必要とされているレベルはカスタマーサポートが行えればいい程度である。英語力よりもカスタマーサポートへの耐性の方が大事だと感じた。

reviews.title: Decent place of employment for a short period of  time
reviews.text: My co-workers and managers helped me in dealing with the workload. However, the company was not organized and poorly communicated with employees, customers, and employees.  The software apps were outdated and inadequate.   I am glad I left.   I do not miss it one bit.

reviews.title: Gvvv
reviews.text:
Pros

Great people to work with and learn from, you get much more responsibility at Booking.com compared to other large companies I have worked for, and this sense of autonomy really makes you feel like you are owning your work and improving your skills in a company that actually cares about your career. Relocation team went above and beyond to really make you feel valued, before you have even started! Culture is friendly and there are always open conversations going on throughout the business on important topics, such as wellbeing, diversity and inclusion. Work/life balance is great and lots of perks!

Cons

Onboarding remotely wasn't the most fun in a pandemic but Booking.com did their best to keep us all engaged throughout the sessions

reviews.title: Mixed experience
reviews.text:
Positives:
-very good office conditions (modern equipment, free food, coffee, relaxed atmosphere)
- great people to work with
-interesting, not boring job (CS department)
Negatives:
- to much stress and pressure due to work overload (not enough employees)
- productivity over quality
- poor employee protection against unfair treatment from management

reviews.title: παραγωγικό και ευχάριστο περιβάλλων
reviews.text: Μια εταιρεία που νοιάζεται για των εργαζομένων, σωστή στης παροχές της, με ένα ευχαριστώ καί φιλικό περιβάλλων, δυνατότητα εξελίξεις, με ένα σχετικό άγχος στην καθημερινότητα για την διευθέτησης προβλημάτων

reviews.title: Une bonne expérience
reviews.text: Grande entreprise qui applique de nombreuses procédures aussi bien pour ses clients que pour ses salariés, ce qui évite les mauvaises surprises. Très formateur, possibilité d'évolution pour les plus motivés.

reviews.title: Terrible place to work
reviews.text: The Booking.com Toronto office  was a terrible place to work. Toxic environment, awful management, poor pay, no room to advance, etc. I would not recommend working here!
reviews.cons: Poor management, low pay, toxic environment

reviews.title: Ένας μήνας εκπαίδευση με ατελείωτα τεστ φρικη
reviews.text: Η εκπαίδευση δεν είχε κανια απολύτως σχέση με τις κρατήσεις κανένας κάνοντας που μάθαμε δεν εφαρμόστηκε δεν ήξερα τι να πη στον κόσμο χρειαζόμουν συνεχή βοήθεια μια σκέτη φρικη
reviews.reviewer: Travel Agent with Greek and English

reviews.title: A Place to Grow in the Real World
reviews.text: I like working for Booking.com. The team is great and values your time. However, the chance to be promoted is very smallso that means a salary raise also is very small. Overall, it is a good middle income company.

reviews.title: Read current news
reviews.text:
Crazy hours- liked the 4 10s but not swing shifting from second to third shift.

Complaints- so many complaints all night long in customer service. You get rated even if the guest had a horrible experience at a hotel. Money doesn't fix things with guests but that's how they handle it.

Amsterdam Trip- got cancelled for most at random and very pre Covid. It was supposed to be a benefit.

No real bonus- would have been nice to have less swag and a more livable wage.

Casual Dress Code, Everyone has the same personality, company parties and swag was fun. Massage chairs and free fruit.

They just laid thousands off world wide. Google is your friend.
